MCCLANE.raw_line: I'm here, I'm here, false alarm, let's just let her down nice and easy -You don't understand, I'm just meeting my wife's-plane - you gotta give me this car back.This is my mother in law's car. She already hates me because I'm not aI can relate to that. Hate it myself- Hey, that's a plastic fender, Jesus- See, I used to be a New York cop still got my ID somewhere -I only moved 'cause my wife got promoted - look, maybe we can settle this right here, we're in Washington, heartbeat of Democracy, one hand washes the other He realizes the truck is DRIVING AWAY one way while the cop is i going off the other way - McClane votes for the cop -Hey, c'mon, it's Christmas -Hello. This is Lieutenant McClane - Somebody there beep me?Holly! Did you land?As far as I'm concerned, progress peaked with the frozen pizza.Just speeding on sugar, thanks to your parents. I really appreciate you coming a day late, honey. Nothing I like better than a weekend with the Munsters.Coming out of the phone booth and almost COLLIDING with -You and me both, pal. The hell with it. Now it's Stuart's turn to look at McClane oddly; then he moves off. McClane looks after him, trying to place him... shrugs... heads for the bar.turns to watch them exit, sees them SPLIT up outside the bar. Quickly, McClane goes over to the Airport cops.Excuse me, officers. This may be a total wild goose chase, but I think I just saw - He STOPS. CAMERA ADJUSTS. The cop he's talking to is the asshole who towed away the car.Elvis. McClane turns, throws money near his glass and quickly exits the bar.Open this. Got a cop on duty around here?This is a restricted area. You boys too impatient to wait for the skycaps?Drops from the belt, crouches near big gears. Desperate, he looks around for a weapon, anything. Then he notices all the luggage going past: Suitcases, camera cases, a bicycle... Skis.Half on the belt, half off, he fends off the other man and SEES-WINCES as blood SPLATTERS - and then REACTS as the 20 foot tall conduit pipe CREAKS, BENDS-TOPPLES- he RIDES IT DOWN-Cleveland?One of the cops hands McClane his wallet. As he pockets it, he notes the CROWD milling about the luggage area.Whoa, wait a second. This is a crime scene. Aren't you going to seal off this area?Up to the Captain? Take me up to the Captain, too.Lorenzo?No. Just a little professional courtesy.Okay. Forget the courtesy. How about lust the professional? Your boys dust walked away from a crime scene - you need to seal it off, get a forensics team in, dust it, shootYou store them somewhere -Luggage? That "punk" pulled a Glock Seven on me. Know what that is? A porcelain gun from Germany. It doesn't show up on airport x-ray machines... and it costs more than you earn in a month.If it's more than a dollar eighty nine, yeah -One question, Carmine: Which sets off the metal detectors first: The shit in your brains, or the lead in your ass?Excuse me. He reaches over, gently takes typing paper and a stamp pad.Whoa, guys. (ver quickly showingDidn't you ever have an airport stiffYup, he's dead,. all right. Thanks. And he's gone as they look after him, puzzled.Excuse me, honey - can I borrow your office for a minute? Before she can answer, he's over the counter and reaching for her phone.Hey, partner. Get that twinky out of your mouth and grab a pencil.Vacation? Holly stood me up for a last minute meeting. I'm alone in DC with the in-laws.R' ht. Listen, Al, what's our FAX n u mber in the station there?Yeah, well my wife's company makes 'em, I figure it's time to get one of them pregnant. This way?From a stiff down here at Dulles. I marked the whorls with a pen in case the transmission's fuzzy. Can you run that through State and Federal for me - throw in Interpol if you got it.I don't know. Just a feeling.The FAX number is uh -Al?What can you tell me?You needed a computer for that?What?Yeah, I see it. Thanks a lot, Al. I owe you. He hangs up. The girl gives him the eye.Just the FAX,, ma'am. Just the FAX.Depends who you are.Yeah. Now he's on the Network interviewing Transsexual Gum Surgeons and laughing all the way to the bank.Nah. I do needlepoint. And he's at the end of the walkway and he quickly disappears into the crowd, leaving Sam pissed, puzzled... and out of breath.I'm a police officer, Mr. Trudeau-I think something serious is going to happen here tonight -Anybody try and fix the deck tonight? Anything weird going on besides the shooting?What's that?Okay. You clot back-up - back-up for everything you think can go wrong. What about something nobody anticipated? Not accidents, notDamned straight the human element. You've got the world's biggest drug dealer on the way, one body and a'- lot of questionsl Doesn't anyone want to look for answers?Jesus...This? This ain't it, pal. This is just the beginning. A PHONE RINGS. CAMERA ADJUSTS. It's a prominent RED PHONE.Maybe they don't.Esperanza? Trudeau nods -What's all that about?Meaning they pull Esperanza off his plane and take him anywhere there's no extradition treaties.About time, Carmine. Guess you have to light a fire under your ass to light a fire under your ass.Monday morning? My wife's on one of those planes these aasstards are fucking with! That makes me a player on the fucking field, you putz! And if you got off your fat ass when I told you to, maybe we wouldn't be knee deep in shit right now!Trudeau, can't you see you're dealing with pros? You can't fuck with theseAnything you can think-of, they'll think of, too! But the elevator DOORS CLOSE on him and now Lorenzo turns a KEY on the control panel, then SPEAKS into his walkie talkie.Shit!(opening the controlI don't believe this... another fucking elevator... another fucking basement... why does this always happen to me? He moves through the cavernous maze, and then REACTS to MUSIC. Moves towards it. And arrives in -Who the fuck are you? In response, the man points to the NAMETAG on his coveralls.You're what, the janitor?Come on, Marvin. I wasn't born yesterday. Carmine Lorenzo know you don't go home after you punch out?I'm a veteran myself, Marvin. And a married one. You married?My wife may be in some trouble upstairs. I gotta find out. This set up of yours? I won't tell a soul... provided you patch me into this panel, 'let me eavesdrop on the tower. What do you say?Christ. They're gonna try something cute... where's this annex skywalk?Shit, it's a fucking bottleneck. Anybody smart enough to shut down the airport is smart enough to figure this... it's a perfect place for an ambush...Tunnels.Looks like... maybe a mile. Easy jog.Whoa.I owe you one, Marvin. How about a sixpack of malt liquor?in the TUNNELS, he tosses off his sweater into the darkness. Underneath, his shirt is already sweat-stained. And then he HEARS the gunfire - it's close! He gets his bearings -LUNGES through a wall of STEAM -deliberately SMASHES into the cross bars he passes, one after another, the SMACK of his body into them sounding like linebackers in combat -has a moment of satisfaction - thenOh, fucklands, HARD, the plywood boards from the top of the scaffold SWEEPING him off his feet - his gun SKITTERS across the linoleum towards the far end of the slidewalk - he rolls over and SEESYou okay?.Time you don't have...What...?So are you. Break the code -There's five dead officers here, Colonel Stuart - Isn't that penalty enough?Yeah, Colonel. We were both famous for five minutes. Saw you get shit canned by Congress on TV. How much drug money is Esperanza paying you to turn traitor?And lesson one starts with killing policemen? What's lesson two - the Neutron bomb?CAMERA PUSHES IN on him as he turns and looks out the window.No... no, Jesus, Mary, Mother of God, no... pull up... pull up...Behind the plane, watching the fireball roll away from him. He gives the scream of an. animal in a trap and falls to his knees.Relax, pal, I'm not a survivor. I'm just another victim. He grabs the rescue worker by the collar..the last fucking victim he'll ever have.Trudeau... I... I...Do you? Do you? I've been a cop 13 years... Everything from... lost kids to hostages... but... all of it was... taking care of business... taking care of peoplle... until tonight. Tonight, everything I did, everything I tried...And...?John McClane.Unfortunately the pros are on the other side. Colonel Stuart is one of your boys -Trudeau. Did things just get better... or worse?That's all we keep hearing. Can you do anything with it?My wife has less than two.Except Colonel Stuart? The kid can't answer. Then Grant appears, the MAN from the Justice Department in tow.They kind of busted me down to buck private.The code... the code's still punched... where did you get this?How about I let you live?Marvin... you show me a shortcut to runway fifteen and you got yourself a liner for that coat.Come to poppa, you son-of-a-bitch- He flies up the ladder - and BRUISES his shoulder against the locked grid.Shit!Thought you'd pull this off, didn't you? I guess you didn't count on me being here. Actually, I didn't count on me being here.Just a cop who's spent half his career busting scumbag lowlife dope dealers. Looks like it's business as usual. Think this will look good on my record? Suddenly BULLETS PING on the hatch inches from McClane's head.he's HIT in the left hand.Esperanza's down... but he's hurt. I killed one more man... that's six they've lost all together..The story of my life. But the enlisted men seem sympathetic. And so doesStuart's guys? Yeah. That means they're on the field or close -So - if they know this too - they could be sitting around the fireplace and hanging their fucking stockings in one of these houses?Are you sure or not?You didn't do that - you did yourThen how would you feel about a volunteer?Hell. These people are hanging their Goddamn stockings. They DROP down into the snow, CRUNCH to the next fence. Look- and these people aren't.Could be a sentry -Then why is he going over his own footprints?moves from shadow to shadow and tree to tree like an Indian I stalking a settler... closer... closer...Baker is only a yard away. Closer - closer - and then -BEEP!I was wrong. You're not an asshole.taking cover behind a parked car, he HEARS the SOUND ofFuck...This is for flight one fourteen, mother fucker - He FIRES.Shit! He AIMS at the APPROACHING SNOWMOBILES -FIRES -Blanks... blanks? .Paleing, he rummages in the snow, finds one of the soldier's backpacks. More clips inside. First clip has live ammo. Second clip - blanks CAMERA PUSHES in on McClane until he looks at the red/blue tape and -makes the connection.Oh, my God... He gets. to his feet and RUNS.shivering, battered, trying to come down a ladder. He FALLS the rest of the way.They're not gonna do that -they're gonna get on the same Goddamn plane and leave with him! Before the Army canned him, Stuart must have loaded that unit with his own guys -A side show to jerk us off - buy themThese are the bullets they used out there tonight.Thanks; but I'm looking for a different kind of ride. And he POINTS to -I - don't like flying.I like losing worse.Shit! They're leaving!Get 'em to stop! Hover low, block their path!That's my wife's plane, Goddamnit-!panting, he wedges himself against an engine pod - and starts to take off his jacket!I like you better dead.moves hand over hand to a trailing section of the wing. Looks over and down atDROPS 20 FEET, SLAMS into the snow at the edge of the runway, bounces like litter thrown from a moving car - the big REAR TIRE almost rolls over him -battered like a car wreck victim, now he looks up into the dark sky trying to find the SOUND OF JET ENGINES. Then he SEES -Hey, Colonel: Happy Fucking New Year. And he THROWS THE CIGARETTE INTO THE FUEL.DIVES for the ground as the explosion ROLLS TOWARDS HIM.Gets to his knees, and LOOKS at the huge conflagration.Honey... there's your landing lights.Holly - HOLLY -HOLLY!

BACK TO SCENE.raw_line: The man uncoils. Composes himself. Goes to the closet.Dropping his'wallet, McClane JUMPS aside as SHOTS WHIZZ PAST -McClane's COAT takes the BULLET HITS in MID AIR as he LANDS on a conveyor belt, which CARRIES him UP and OVER the gunmen. They FIRE UP at him - He aims.back - and then a SUITCASE falling from another belt and knocks his gun away!McClane PUNCHES Cochrane - again, again - but the guy's gonna kill them both one way or the other - McClane KICKS him, again, again - finally his grip loosens - at the last minute McClane JUMPS to a thick conduit - and then Cochrane gets JAMMEDMcClane FIRES UPWARDS, and then VEERING, he RUNS UNDER the SCAFFOLDING - BULLETS PING off the metal behind him as a'Ae l tries to nail him from ground level - meanwhileMcClane SPINS on the floor and SLAMS the nearest piece of the metal scaffold into the OPEN SLIDEWALK ELECTRONICS. It SHORTS OUT SPECTACULARLY and THEN -the slidewalk in OVERDRIVE, O'Reilly is FLUNG right over McClane's HEAD.McClane takes a long overdue breath. Then he picks up his 4 pistol, checks the'bodies to make sure there's no surprises, and, goes over to Barnes.He turns. CAMERA PUSHES to the whits wall numbers here: "11W3". An ARROW indicates "ACCESS GRID."McClane pushes upwards - grunts - when he shifts his grip his SKIN RIPS on the cold metal - with a grimace, he pushes his rifle out, starts to follow -McClane FIRES, blowing a hole in h m so ' THROAT, and as Garber's slugs come closer, McClane IVES into the cockpit, BULLETS smacking all around him from Garber and Esperanza -She REACTS. No one says anything. She composes herself... goes out.McClane and Barnes huddle, whisper.Grant and Lorenzo come over.Big BOUNCE over a mogul. As the 'mobile settles, McClane pulls the rifle forward. He STEADIES IT alongside the WINDSHIELD of the snowmobile.McClane DUCKS as bullets BLOW OUT his WINDSHIELD. He SWERVES -and there's the other snowmobile that turned. Burke FIRES on FULL AUTOSam taps the Cameraman, who's already on the case.They can't fucking believe this. Then -Stuart STOMPS on McClane's HANDS on the wing - CRUNCH -STOMPS again - McClane SMILES -and then Stuart KICKS HIM OFF THE WING!1 McClave takes a LONG PULL on the cigarette until the tip isThe cameraman brings up his lens.

HOLLY.raw_line: I'd like to think I'm somebody.John, wake up. It's the nineties. Microchips, microwaves, faxes and airphones.We're going to land about thirty minutes late, I wanted you to know. Kids okay?Mom give you any trouble about borrowing her new car?You're on, Lieutenant. They both hang up. The OLDER WOMAN beside Holly smiles at her.My husband doesn't think so.He.means he has filed a restraining order against me. I'm not allowed within fifty feet of him -I knocked out two of his teeth.I don't think so.Yes. Another.Yeah. There's quite a few out there; we're in a regular traffic jam.Don't you mean nauseous?You endangered my children... my husband.. and me.And you didn't do it for anything as noble as "the people". The only time you see the people is when you're climbing over their backs.Listen, Dick -A stronger mouthwash would be nice. He glares at her, moves down the aisle.Writing your acceptance speech for the video sleaze awards?It's hard to blame anyone for theI REACTS to what the woman's said. As the Stewardess PASSES, Holly signals her - RISES halfway to meet her.I... was just wondering. Our flight was only supposed to.be 5 1/2 hours-My God... Then something else sinks in; she looks at the empty airphone cradle on the wall gets quickly out of her seat - in mid-stride she STOPS - takes her seatmate's PURSE. Then, she sidesteps some panicked people, goes to the kitchen area. And finds one of the special keys for the lavatories.Amen to that, asshole. We're sorry, but Mr. Thornberg is experiencing electrical problems. We now resume our regular programming.

STUART.raw_line: Excuse me - Pause as they dance away from each other. Then -(nodding towards theYou can have two: "Fuck" and "you". And the interview is over and he's out the door.You're late.Did you finish your assignment?Then the damage is minor. But the penalty could be severe. In a blur of motion, Stuart is on his feet, the pistol is at Miller's temple. CLICK.Fail me again and it won't be an empty chamber. Dismissed.5 minutes to zero hour. Stand by.Who I am is unimportant. What I want... well, if you don't want those planes overhead to start dropping like flies when they run out of fuel... what I want is very important. All REACT - McClane as much as anyone.A plane is going to be landing at this Airport in 58 minutes. It is FM 1 - Foreign Military 1.This plane is scheduled to be met by a continigent from the U.S. Justice-department. But now there will be a change of plans. This plane will not be met by anyone. It will land on a runway of my designation where it will not be molested. That will conclude my interest in that plane and your responsibility for it. At the same time, I want a 747 cargo conversion fully fueled.I am doing this.Except losing our own team wasn't part of the plan. He comes to a decision. Picks up the phone. Speaks. Voice flat, firm, stern. Around and above him, his men hover over the improvised screens and terminals.Attention, Dulles. You were warned not to try and restore your systems.has reacted to both the mention of his name and of McClane's. His brow furrows. Ah, yes.McClave? John McClane? The... policeman hero who saved the Nakatomi hostages? I read about you in People magazine. You seemed out of your league on Nightline, though...I think Cardinal Richlieu said it best: Treason is merely a matter of dates. And this country has to learn it can't keep cutting the legs off men. like General Esperanza -men with the guts to stand up to Soviet agression.I think we can find something in between. Give me a flight number - one low on fuel. Another man hands him a slip of paper. He reads it, switches to another mike .Windsor flight one-four-teen, this is Dulles Approach... do you copy?Activate ILS landing system. But Recalibrate sea level. Minus 200 feet. 31$p,son - the main TECH here - OBEYS, with an unhealthy GRIN. He punches DIALS - a SCREEN LIGHTS UP - Stuart plays with his mike button to create static as he "switches" the incoming plane from the approach operator to the tower operator - both, of course, played by him...Probably our runway systems coming back up. Don't worry about it you're coming in on instruments.Looking good, Windsor... watch it - there's a 30 knot cross wind and the runway's icy - atta boy -attaSilence here, too. His men look at him. Except for ThampSm, who clearly enjoyed his part in the above, their faces are blank. Maybe they're admiring Stuart's incredible coolness. Maybe.Don't worry, Captain. If this goes into extra innings...We've pussied out around the world, over and over again. We drop the Shah, fuck Marcos, throw Noriega overboard. You know what they think around the globe? The worst thing that can happen to you is to have America as a friend. And now that stain head Gorbachov, he's got some nice English suits, and a wife without gold teeth, so now the Commies are nice? Gentlemen, we are soldiers and we do not believe in fairy tales sweet though they may seem. Well, tonight, the pattern ends. The dominos will fall no more and the ramparts will remain upri-Attention, Dulles Tower...Go ahead, Falcon -(nodding, intoGeneral!He's going to hell.You're ite a little soldier. So - consider this a mi itary unera And he OPENS FIRE. The others instantly join in.How many grenades we have?Use 'em. Pop. Pop pop pop. Each man PULLS TWO PINS - THROWS - Then they run for their jeep, carrying the body of their comrade-Fall back to the Church! Now! Helping the wounded Esperanza, they vanish into the darkness.Gentlemen, you know what to do-UNTOUCHED. But he LOOKS back at the SOUND of SHOTS. HAND SIGNALS his flanking riders.We're on our way. If there's another attempt to stop us like the one-you just made, I will fire several Stinger missiles into your terminal. Do I make myself clear?Good. Please have a ground crew there to confirm the plane's condition.Major Grant, .isn't it?Hatchling, report in. What is your position?My congratulations, gentlemen. You've won a victory for democracy... my pride and admiration... and a kick ass vacation! Get on board! With a CHEER, they run up the stairs 'to the plane.They don't get much of it in the tropics.What?You just get us in the air, General. You're the only one who can do it.in the doorway, tries to AIM - buttrying-to SEE - finally - a GLIMPSE of what has to be McClane -with a savage grin, Stuart takes off his rifle - discards the bulky coat - knife in hand, he steps out.with a victorious SHOUT he YANKS the coat from the aerilon, throws it away - heads for the door -SEES the flame RACING TOWARDS HIM - turns to SHOUT to Esperanza -is BLOWN TO LITTLE PIECES as a FIREBALL BLOWS RIGHT OUT THE DOOR., taking all the remaining soldiers with it and then

TRUDEAU.raw_line: lighting a cigarette, he hovers over BARNES.Weather may have screwed up the line. Switch over to our own back up and run a check. Barnes hits a switch. The ALARM STOPS. Everyone relaxes.Couldn't be helped, I guess. What was it, gangs?Who the hell is this?That's what I said about my last cholesterol test. What's your problem-Hey. Something serious happens every night, only it doesn't make the newspapers. Ever see those guys on TV, juggling knives and cha n i saws? That's what we're doing with those planes up there, only we do it one handed 'cause the other hand's playing 3 card monte with the planes on the ground.One way we manage the planes. But we've got backup - Long look from McClane.The human element..?Lorenzo. Have all your shift Commanders report in... now.I want them to report anything out of the ordinary --no matter how trivial. You got that?What is it?Go to emegency lighting... now!Shunt to another terminal!We're on the same Goddamn grid and we're hot! Already the SPEAKER BOXES are beginning to CHATTER -Jacoby, Strauss. Get your controllers on the horn - every plane approaching our Vortacs that's not in our pattern yet gets turned away'now. Everyone already inside our patrn holds at the outer marker. Stack 'em, pack 'em, and rack 'em. Move. I want every off duty controller and technician here in five minutes. Page the terminal - no, better, beep them.Put it on speaker.How. did you get on this line? Who is this?This is off limits, Coleman, you know that! Together with McClane she's shoved into the elevator.Get what you need. Borrow, steal, kill.Put me on all bands... Trudeau waits as switches are thrown, and then takes the jack from the ear/phone he wears and jacks it into a panel.This is Dulles approach to all aircraft holding.at Potomic Vortac. We are experiencing...Our NAV and Approach systems are down and we expect to lose voice in another minute. We want you to continue holding at the outer marker as directed and wait for further instructions. As - as soon as we're back on line we'll expedite your landings on a.fuel emergency basis. Good luck...Okay. Change the boards.That's the runway between here and the new terminal... he wants to make all of.us watch it.Oh, God...no...Everything's dead.Christ. It's McClane. He'll get himself killed -Barnes. We have to warn those planes we got a lunatic down here who likes to pretend he's the tower. Get up to the cab and get us on the air.With your Goddamn brain! Barnes leaves. McClane blinks, coming around to reality. Sees Trudeau.You don't have to say anything, McClane. We all know how you feel.Our own SWAT team's gone. We called the Government for help. They're sending in a special Army unit. Tactical Terrorist Team... McClane sees something else there in his eyes.Your wife's plane...? They keep broadcasting, even though we can't answer. They... they'll run out of fuel in 90 minutes. CAMERA PUSHES IN on McClane.Obey.It is. It's in hanger eleven. That's the most remote building we've got. Stuart looks at his map, then the hanger mentioned; not far.Quite clear.Christ - that fucking asshole -I-I didn't mean any harm - I just wanted ratings - I had to do it it was sweeps week -They already know. Listen. And sure enough, there it is - the SOUND of ENGINES -

BARNES.raw_line: We just lost FAA approach control.We did. lose FAA approach control-Oh, my God... Everyone turns at the chill in Barne's voice.Emergencies! Controllers, Code Yellow! People leap into action... meanwhile, Trudeau and the others MOVE around the tower, the CAMERA FOLLOWING in a 180 TURN, watch as the LIGHTS KEEP GOING OUT.Confirmed! ILS is dead - every Goddamn system is dead!A 747 has the furthest flight capacity of anything we've got here. Take out the seats and save some weight, add the wing tanks and it could go to Australia, Africa, Asia - hell the whole Goddamn world.'--guys, guys, all we have to do is find a way to transmit -We have one.All with their reservation computers, all tied into a nice big antenna array so they can talk to their home offices- it's just sitting there waiting to go on line -We're in the annex skywalk. I can see the dish! I'll call you as soon as it's hot for a protocol test.is CUT badly on the arm by flying GLASS - he CRINGES behind a dumpster while the three remaining cops EXCHANGE FIRE with the four soldiers. BULLETS hit near his metal case. He takes a 77 deep breath - rescues it!--me? I'll live. But Lorenzo's SWAT team is dead... and the antenna array is toast. Start looking for a new miracle. AN EERIE ALIEN TYPE VOICE makes them both jump; McClane raises his GUN.Some kind of scrambler so even if we scan their frequency we can't listen in. Descramble mode must activate on this code panel.Eight numbers - that's 8 X 7 X 6 timesDon't do it... you bastards, don't do it..! Desperate, McClane runs to the spilled paint, grabs turpentine, rags, pieces of scaffolding.What are you doing?Come on, see the torch, see theOn the air? With what?And wait for those lunatics to shoot them out? And where do we get those "big portable lights"? Borrow them from Batman?Your vote? You voted for Dukakis! (exasperated, to anotherGreat, that leaves thirteen accidents waiting to happen. Are they still bucking headwinds? That's eating up most of their fuel.Damn! The Outer Marker! (on t eir loo s It's a beacon, right? A radio beacon, that sends out this "boop-boop-boop" so they know they're over it, right?So, who says that radio signal has to be just "boop-boop boop"?-and we can talk to the planes and those bas ar s w o did this will never know! And as faces brighten for the first time in hours, we-repeat, do not accept any instructions claiming to be from our tower unless you hear your own flight recorder access code. We will get this from your respective airlines and use it for confirmation.What do we do?Who now pulls McClane aside.McClane. You said they showed up there right away?I think I know where. Interested, McClane'follows Barnes around the corner.These are the old plans when the longer runways went in... that's twelve years ago. And it looks like they did some modifications on site... moved Tracon, phone, ILS - all the underground stuff -so they could handle drainage. If I'm right, all of it would run along the edge of the airport property - and go right past this neighborhood.Maybe. Yeah. Well, seventy eighty per cent, five percent either way-I was sure about tying into the antenna array. And... and I got five officers killed.I had a choice and I made it. But those cops didn't have a choice, and neither do those soldiers now. I'm an engineer, McClane. It's supposed to a wires and circuits... iron and steel. Not flesh and blood. Not lives. If...if I'm wrong again... I don't want anyone else to get orders that could get them killed.Four more possibles. Three houses... and a church. They cross the intersection on foot, walk over a lawn. It's further to the next place; more prosperous yard. Suddenly McClane puts up his hand -Barnes stops - both look at -And he could just be out for a walk-REACTS, begins to dial the phone. REACTS toJust get here,.this is it, move your fat ass will ya -? Grant signals his Sergeant and then it's like D-Day as ALL the SOLDIERS and some COPS hustle out -is in the street. Moving in a crouch, McClave heads towards him. Barnes points toOne forty is down! They used the fire to see -

THORNBERG.raw_line: Fine. Done, I accept it. But why the hell can't I get the First Class Meal--my-Network paid for instead of this swill?Do youknow who I am?You think you're funny? 'I've got your numberStewardess!You cannot put me near that woman.So is that plane... practically. Despite herself, she looks out.There's nothing regular about it.The people have a right to know, Mrs. McClane. You got in the way of that.Victor. Victor!Did you pack the radio mikes from the shoot, or put them in your carry on?I love you. Get one of the receivers. Puzzled, the man pulls his bag from under the seat, gets one out.You just said it would work -Stay on it. Tell me if anything changes.Holy shit - we - we gotta get this on tape - Victor GRINS. And pulls a MICROCASSETTE RECORDER from his shirt pocket. It is ALREADY JACKED INTO THE RECEIVER and TURNING. Thornberg all but cackles.Jesus!Boy, am I good...Try Pulitzer, Mrs. McClane. But now that stewardess reaches up and turns on the TV PROJECTOR. As the lights DARKEN, Thornberg decides this is perfect cover. pretending he's getting a blanket overhead, he slips his credit card in one of airphones. Then he moves down the aisle, phone I inside his jacket.I- I'm going to be sick - He makes a croaking noise to sell it, stumbles into the lavatory.This is Richard Thornberg. Put me through to the News Director.Well, none of them is me. You want proof? Try this - And he PLAYS the MICROCASSETTE. We HEAR Barnes' earlierI want you to go live, now. Key me in from the files, a publicity shot, whatever, Connie's got one. And a map, steal one from weather-Network, here we come....,and if this should be my final

LORENZO.raw_line: Captain Lorenzo.Yeah, I know. You think that LA badge is gonna get you a free lunch or something down here?In an airport Christmas week? You gotta be kidding.And what do we do with all the luggage for all the airplanes while we play Charlie Chan?Oh. And meanwhile every hour a few more thousand people come and they want to put their luggage on airplanes, so we store them and their luggage in some other "somewhere"? Hell, why don't we shut down the whole fucking airport? Whaddya think they'll say upstairs when I tell them that?You'd be surprised what I earn in a month.Now get the hell out of my office before I have you thrown out of my airport! McClane moves towards the door, his hands waving off the would be bouncers.-well, the press was here, crawling all over the Esperanza story... so they got it right on the fucking news, bloodstains and all...L.A., Mr. Lorenzo-don't mean shit-What? You're buying into this -I got it.Maybe we should call the power company...?How could they know already -?They're talking to us on our own Goddamn system! They gotta be close - I'll have my men tear this airportMcClane, I got a first class unit here, SWAT team and all, and we don't need any Monday morning quarterbacks.Security! You're out of here! And already two big Airport cops are trotting over. As Trudeau REACTS, unsure -Mr. Trudeau. Do I have to remind you about FAA regulations regarding unauthorized personnel in the control tower?Oh, no, no way -Lobby Security, come in.And Lorenzo here, with two unauthorized personnel in the fucking tower! Get your thumb out of your ass and get over to the elevator. Get them out and post a guard or you're gonna have a pink slip in your Christmas stocking! Rattled, the guard signals a comrade, hustles to obey.I want my Swat team to go with him as cover. Whatever we can think of - they can think of, too. He says it like he thought of it himself. Then -He's bluffing - Lorenzo leaves. Trudeau ain't so sure.McClane! Keep out of this! You- He stops, seeing the chilling look Trudeau is giving him.You're where - you crazy idiot, why' didn't you -McClane, what the hell do you think you're doing, playing John Wayne? How'd you like to spend the rest of the night in a cell -You can't talk to me like that -Hey. Where the fuck is McClane?McClane! Are you out of your fucking mind-?Who the fuck are you?They left to shoot those bastards out of the sky -But - that firefight at the house-You're completely around the fucking bend, McClane. And you know what else? You're under arrest - McClane steps back - raises the assault rifle - FIRES.Wha - how -Holy shit -Move that piece of shit! Henderson, get some crowd control! Goddamn it, clear the area-! McClane jumps out of the car - looks around and SEES -

MARVIN.raw_line: They're valuble, you know. Me, I like those old 78's. Won't find me switching like everybody else to these new fangled 45's.Damn straight. Janitor, and proud of it. Don't need any of this new fangled custodial engineer crap. Just do my job and screw the fancy talk. You know, you're not supposed to be down here.W-who said I was living here? McClane shows his badge.L-Lorenzo? C-come on, officer, I can barely get by, even with my pension. You know, I'm a vet, WW 2? If it wasn't for guys like me, you kids' be eatin' sushi today. I'm just trying to. save a few. bucks -I could. get fired if you tell. McClane moves over to a big panel with telephone lines and jacks. Examines it as he speaks.Six times.You a cop or a lawyer?Annex skywalk...? Sounds like the pissant World's Fair... He rummages around, finds a big wrinkled MAP, smoothes it out.Lemme see... yeah, must be this... connects to the new terminal - Marvin points to an ELEVATED WALKWAY connecting the two complexes.Now, see? Here's you. And here's the skywalk.Winter up there... Summer down here. He aims Marvin's flashlight down there, isn't enchanted with what he sees. He turns, takes Marvin's map.How 'bout a case of Johnny Walker? Hey, I may be homeless, but I ain't tasteless.Hey, officer. Thought you'd be upstairs by now, hanging out with the top brass.I know that feeling. Interested in a nice coat?I was just a kid, working those radios on the B-29's. But I kept up. Still read Popular Mechanics. These transistor things, I'm on top of 'em - Marvin realizes that McClane has'a funny expression.You okay, son?Came with the coat; over near the luggage belts. Looks like one of them Japanese radios... can't hold a candle to a nice Zenith if you ask me... You like it, huh? How about twenty dollars?. Man knows how to bargain...whistling, stacking dolls, shoes, more flotsom from the Airport sea he's scavenged. At a SOUND he TURNS -This man's been through serious shit,(pointing to hisDamned if I'm cleaning up this mess. McClane and Holly get in the cart. Marvin drives them away, light BLINKING... and we PULLBACK until McClane and Holly are just part of the crowd.

GRANT.raw_line: One crisis... one dozen. Who are you?McClane... Oh, yeah, you're the one who tried to save that plane tonight.cto his men) All right, hustle! Command post will be in the Airport Police office. I want to be tied into the Tower and every sysytem that's still working in fifteen minutes!Trudeau. Lorenzo. You brief me on that plane he asked for, I'll fill you in on my orders. In my office. Now. "My office" meaning Lorenzo's. Lorenzo glowers at that, but the little group moves in that direction - then the JUSTICE GUY puts up his hand to block McClane -McClane, we don't need a loose cannon on this deck. What if they decide to crash another plane in retaliation for your little stunt?Maybe they're more creative than youGentlemen. We have... a situation here... CLICK CLICK SNAP. AMMO CLIPS are broken out - all PIGGYBACKED like combat hardened troops do it, two banana clips taped together with blue tape.Oh, no, Carmine?i No, you were right. I'm just your- kind of asshole.Close up the back, then we go in. Fire only on my order. McClane and Barnes watch as the soldiers start to close the net.Evacuate! Now!If you remember me, Colonel, you'll remember I know the drill as well as you do. Check out your own fucking plane.Grenada - five minutes of firefight five weeks of surfing! LAUGHTER, which SUBSIDES a bit as Grant looks at his watch.. a look DUPLICATED by the others.So do we, kid.Yeah. Then we wouldn't have to do this. And in a flash, Grant DRAWS his combat knife and SLITS the kid's throat! Telford FLOPS BACK off the bench. Grant is already digging into the cargo pocket of his trousers and he comes out with a transceiver - the same distinctive scrambled transceiver used by Stuarts men!Congratulations on your escape, sir.I've had enough fucking snow for a lifetime.(through his teeth, astoo late, he realizes he's over the front edge of the wing! He screams and FALLS -
